titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the W. Irving Crandall papers, 1858-1892
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains letters dealing with the presidential election of 1860, the Japanese Embassy, the iron industry in Tenn., and Brazilian agriculture, social life and customs. Correspondents include Clement Claiborne Clay, Jr., Charles Frederick Hartt, Alexander Hamilton Stephens, Angus Cameron, David McKendree Key, David Clopton, and Robert Barnwell Rhett.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: W. Irving Crandall Papers, 1858-1892, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains letters dealing with the presidential election of 1860, the Japanese Embassy, the iron industry in Tenn., and Brazilian agriculture, social life and customs. Correspondents include Clement Claiborne Clay, Jr., Charles Frederick Hartt, Alexander Hamilton Stephens, Angus Cameron, David McKendree Key, David Clopton, and Robert Barnwell Rhett.
